TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Surrogate key to uniquely identify a record.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: ROW_WID

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This code identifies the AP term.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AP_TERM_CODE

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the name of the AP term.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AP_TERM_NAME

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the full description of the AP term. AP terms can include a discount % for early AP and you can assign multiple discounts to each AP term line.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AP_TERM_DESC

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the duration of the AP term.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AP_TERM_DURATION

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the number of days limit of the AP term.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: DAY_LIMIT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the first condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_1_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the second condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_2_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the third condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_3_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the fourth condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_4_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the fifth condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_5_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the sixth condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_6_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the seventh condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_7_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the eighth condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_8_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the ninth condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_9_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the tenth condition.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CONDITION_10_TEXT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates if AP term is active.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: ACTIVE_FLG

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Source Record Created By User Surrogate Key
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is a foreign key to the W_USER_D dimension indicating the user who created the record in the source system.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CREATED_BY_WID

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Source Record Last Modified By User Surrogate Key
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is a foreign key to the W_USER_D dimension indicating the user who last modified the record in the source system.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CHANGED_BY_WID

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Source Record Creation Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the date and time when the record was initially created in the source system.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CREATED_ON_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Source Record Last Modified Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the date and time when the record was last modified in the source system.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CHANGED_ON_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Auxiliary Source Table Last Modified Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Oracle system field. This column identifies the last modified date and time of the auxiliary table's record which acts as a source for the current table.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Auxiliary Source Table Last Modified Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Oracle system field. This column identifies the last modified date and time of the auxiliary table's record which acts as a source for the current table.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Auxiliary Source Table Last Modified Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Oracle system field. This column identifies the last modified date and time of the auxiliary table's record which acts as a source for the current table.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Auxiliary Source Table Last Modified Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Oracle system field. This column identifies the last modified date and time of the auxiliary table's record which acts as a source for the current table.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Source Supplied Effective From Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column stores the date from which the source record (in the Source system) is effective. The value is extracted from the source (whenever available)
TARGETFIELD.NAME: SRC_EFF_FROM_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Source Supplied Effective To Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column stores the date up to which the source record (in the Source system) is effective. The value is extracted from the source (whenever available)
TARGETFIELD.NAME: SRC_EFF_TO_DT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column stores the date from which the dimension record is effective. A value is either assigned by Oracle BI Applications or extracted from the source.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column stores the date up to which the dimension record is effective. A value is either assigned by Oracle BI Applications or extracted from the source.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: EFFECTIVE_TO_DT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This flag indicates the deletion status of the record in the source system. A value of "Y" indicates that the record is deleted from the source system and logically deleted from the Data Warehouse; a value of "N" indicates that the record is active.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: DELETE_FLG

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is a flag for marking dimension records as "Y" in order to represent the current state of a dimension entity. This flag is typically critical for Type II slowly-changing dimensions, as records in a Type II situation tend to be numerous.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: CURRENT_FLG

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Warehouse Record Insert Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column stores the date on which the record was inserted in the Data Warehouse table.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: W_INSERT_DT

TARGETFIELD.BUSINESSNAME: Warehouse Record Update Date and Time
TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column stores the date on which the record was last updated in the Data Warehouse table.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: W_UPDATE_DT

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column is the unique identifier of the source system from which data was extracted. In order to be able to trace the data back to its source, Oracle recommends that you define separate unique source IDs for each of your different source instances.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: DATASOURCE_NUM_ID

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Oracle system field. This column is the unique identifier for the specific ETL process used to create or update this data.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: ETL_PROC_WID

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column is the unique identifier of a dimension or fact entity in its source system. In case of composite keys, the value in this column can consist of concatenated parts.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: INTEGRATION_ID

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column represents a unique identifier often used by source systems for the purpose of data sharing, reducing redundancies and minimizing system maintenance tasks, or even to drive data visibility. From a Data Warehouse standpoint, the intended use of this column is to drive dimensional data security, primarily.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: SET_ID

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column is the unique identifier for a Tenant in a multi-tenant environment. This would typically be used in an Application Service Provider (ASP) / Software As a Service (SOAS) model.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: TENANT_ID

TARGETFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This column is used as a generic field for customer extensions.
TARGETFIELD.NAME: X_CUSTOM

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: Based on the Type2 Dimension's natural key, DATASOURCE_NUM_ID and a given date, this lookup transformation is used to look for the corresponding surrogate key to be used as a foreign key in the fact/dimension table. For the incremental-load session, this lookup SQL will have an override joining with the staging area table on the Type2 Dimension's natural key column as well as the DATASOURCE_NUM_ID. This will restrict the cache being created for the Type2 dimension natural keys which have appeared in the current staging area records, and improve the overall performance.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: LKP_W_USER_D

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Lookup Sql Override
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: SELECT LOOKUP_TABLE.ROW_WID as ROW_WID, LOOKUP_TABLE.DATASOURCE_NUM_ID as DATASOURCE_NUM_ID, LOOKUP_TABLE.INTEGRATION_ID as INTEGRATION_ID, LOOKUP_TABLE.EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT as EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT, LOOKUP_TABLE.EFFECTIVE_TO_DT as EFFECTIVE_TO_DT FROM W_USER_D LOOKUP_TABLE

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Lookup condition
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: DATASOURCE_NUM_ID = IN_DATASOURCE_NUM_ID AND INTEGRATION_ID = IN_INTEGRATION_ID AND EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT <= IN_DATE AND EFFECTIVE_TO_DT >= IN_DATE

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This sequence generator transformation is used to generate surrogate keys for the table W_AP_TERMS_D. This is a reusable transformation and should be used for every source system adapters in order to ensure unique keys across the source system adapters like Oracle Applications, SAP, PeopleSoft and so on.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Seq_W_AP_TERMS_D_Wid

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This is a reusable expression transformation to be used by all Type2 dimension load mappings. Given inputs like Update Flag value, the Next value from Sequence Generator, Source-side effectivity information, value of Delete flag of existing record and a few more system columns from the target table, it gives back the right effective start and end date and the right value of current flag along with other system columns to be used in the target table.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: EXP_SCD2_DATES

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: GREATEST ( DECODE(INP_AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, TO_DATE('01-JAN-1899','DD-MON-YYYY'), INP_AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT), DECODE(INP_AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, TO_DATE('01-JAN-1899','DD-MON-YYYY'), INP_AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT), DECODE(INP_AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, TO_DATE('01-JAN-1899','DD-MON-YYYY'), INP_AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT), DECODE(INP_AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, TO_DATE('01-JAN-1899','DD-MON-YYYY'), INP_AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT) )
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: LATEST_AUX_DATE_VAR

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: GREATEST ( DECODE(INP_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, TO_DATE('01-JAN-1899','DD-MON-YYYY'), INP_CHANGED_ON_DT), LATEST_AUX_DATE_VAR )
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(ISNULL(INP_SRC_EFF_TO_DT), DEFAULT_EFF_TO_DATE, IIF(INP_SRC_EFF_FROM_DT > INP_SRC_EFF_TO_DT, DEFAULT_EFF_TO_DATE, INP_SRC_EFF_TO_DT))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(INP_UPDATE_FLG = 'D', IIF(EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT = DEFAULT_EFF_TO_DATE, IIF(ISNULL(INP_DELETED_ON_DT),SESSSTARTTIME, INP_DELETED_ON_DT),EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT), IIF(INP_UPDATE_FLG = 'U', IIF(ISNULL(INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR),SESSSTARTTIME, INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR), IIF(INP_UPDATE_FLG = 'S', IIF(ISNULL(INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR),SESSSTARTTIME, INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR),NULL)))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: SCD_VAR

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(INP_UPDATE_FLG = 'S', IIF(INP_OLD_EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT < SCD_VAR, IIF(SCD_VAR < EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT,'S', 'U'), 'U'), INP_UPDATE_FLG)
TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION_DESCRIPTION: IIF(UPDATE_FLAG = 'S', IIF(EXT_EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT = DEFAULT_EFF_FROM_DATE, IIF(OD_CURR_EFF_FROM_DT < SCD_VAR, IIF(SCD_VAR < EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT,'S','U'),'U'),'U'), UPDATE_FLAG)
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: UPDATE_FLAG_VAR

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION:
IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'I' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'B' , IIF(EXT_EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT = DEFAULT_EFF_FROM_DATE, TO_DATE('01-JAN-1899','DD-MON-YYYY'),EXT_EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT),
IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'S', IIF(ISNULL(INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR),SESSSTARTTIME,INP_CHANGED_ON_DT_VAR),
IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'U' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'D', INP_OLD_EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT,
NULL)))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION:
IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'I' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'S', HI_DATE_VAR,
IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'B', IIF(EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT = DEFAULT_EFF_TO_DATE, IIF(ISNULL(INP_DELETED_ON_DT),SESSSTARTTIME,INP_DELETED_ON_DT), EXT_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT),
IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR= 'U' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'D', IIF(INP_OLD_EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT < HI_DATE_VAR,HI_DATE_VAR, INP_OLD_EFFECTIVE_TO_DT),
NULL)))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: EFFECTIVE_TO_DT

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'I' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'B' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'S', SESSSTARTTIME, IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'U' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'D', INP_OLD_W_INSERT_DT,NULL))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: W_INSERT_DT

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'I' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'B' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'S' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'U' OR UPDATE_FLAG_VAR = 'D', SESSSTARTTIME,NULL)
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: W_UPDATE_DT

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: Looks up W_PARAM_G for the ETL_PROC_WID
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: LKP_W_PARAM_G_Get_ETL_PROC_WID

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: Based on the source code value and the DATASOURCE_NUM_ID, this lookup transformation is used to look for the standardized CODE - NAME pair for the category "AP_TERM" in the chosen data warehouse language, the value of which is passed through mapping parameters during the load process.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: LKP_CODES_AP_TERM

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Lookup Sql Override
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: SELECT W_CODE_D.MASTER_CODE as MASTER_CODE, W_CODE_D.MASTER_VALUE as MASTER_VALUE, W_CODE_D.SOURCE_CODE as SOURCE_CODE, W_CODE_D.DATASOURCE_NUM_ID as DATASOURCE_NUM_ID FROM W_CODE_D WHERE W_CODE_D.CATEGORY = 'AP_TERM' AND W_CODE_D.LANGUAGE_CODE = '$$LANGUAGE_CODE'

MAPPLET.DESCRIPTION: This mapplet is responsible for transforming specific types of columns in the table W_AP_TERMS_D. Jobs done here include Code-Name pair resolution, Dimension Surrogate Key generation, Handling the effective dates for slowly changing dimensions, System Columns generation and so on.
MAPPLET.NAME: mplt_SIL_APTermsDimension

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This is the place where a bulk of the transformations/conversions take place. Some standard examples include currency conversion (if required), date to date_wid conversion, stamping of system columns like W_INSERT_DT, W_UPDATE_DT and so on.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Transform

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This expression transformation acts as a staging area to receive the ports from the previous mapplet input transformation. In order to send the same port (like DATASOURCE_NUM_ID) into more than one transformation at the same time (like lookups etc) downstream in the mapping, the starting point cannot be a mapplet input transformation. This is the primary reason we have this expression transformation at this position.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Validate

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This mapplet is responsible for transforming specific types of columns in the table W_AP_TERMS_D. Jobs done here include Code-Name pair resolution, Dimension Surrogate Key generation, Handling the effective dates for slowly changing dimensions, System Columns generation and so on.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: mplt_SIL_APTermsDimension

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This is the place where a bulk of the transformations/conversions take place. Some standard examples include currency conversion (if required), date to date_wid conversion, stamping of system columns like W_INSERT_DT, W_UPDATE_DT and so on.
INSTANCE.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Transform

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This expression transformation acts as a staging area to receive the ports from the previous mapplet input transformation. In order to send the same port (like DATASOURCE_NUM_ID) into more than one transformation at the same time (like lookups etc) downstream in the mapping, the starting point cannot be a mapplet input transformation. This is the primary reason we have this expression transformation at this position.
INSTANCE.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Validate

METADATAEXTENSION.DESCRIPTION: The target data model version that this mapping is designed to load
METADATAEXTENSION.NAME: OLAP_Version

METADATAEXTENSION.DESCRIPTION: The target data model version that this mapping is designed to load
METADATAEXTENSION.NAME: OLAP_Version

MAPPLET.DESCRIPTION: This mapplet is responsible for transforming specific types of columns in the table W_AP_TERMS_D. Jobs done here include Code-Name pair resolution, Dimension Surrogate Key generation, Handling the effective dates for slowly changing dimensions, System Columns generation and so on.
MAPPLET.NAME: mplt_SIL_APTermsDimension_CodeLookup

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This is the place where a bulk of the transformations/conversions take place. Some standard examples include currency conversion (if required), date to date_wid conversion, stamping of system columns like W_INSERT_DT, W_UPDATE_DT and so on.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Transform

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This expression transformation acts as a staging area to receive the ports from the previous mapplet input transformation. In order to send the same port (like DATASOURCE_NUM_ID) into more than one transformation at the same time (like lookups etc) downstream in the mapping, the starting point cannot be a mapplet input transformation. This is the primary reason we have this expression transformation at this position.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Validate

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This mapplet is responsible for transforming specific types of columns in the table W_AP_TERMS_D. Jobs done here include Code-Name pair resolution, Dimension Surrogate Key generation, Handling the effective dates for slowly changing dimensions, System Columns generation and so on.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: mplt_SIL_APTermsDimension_CodeLookup

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This is the place where a bulk of the transformations/conversions take place. Some standard examples include currency conversion (if required), date to date_wid conversion, stamping of system columns like W_INSERT_DT, W_UPDATE_DT and so on.
INSTANCE.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Transform

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This expression transformation acts as a staging area to receive the ports from the previous mapplet input transformation. In order to send the same port (like DATASOURCE_NUM_ID) into more than one transformation at the same time (like lookups etc) downstream in the mapping, the starting point cannot be a mapplet input transformation. INSTANCE.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Validate

METADATAEXTENSION.DESCRIPTION: The target data model version that this mapping is designed to load
METADATAEXTENSION.NAME: OLAP_Version

MAPPING.DESCRIPTION: This mapping is responsible for loading dimension records for the table W_AP_TERMS_D based on the corresponding staging area table. This mapping takes care of inserting new records as well as updating existing records in the target table. On a requirement basis, this mapping also 'soft-deletes' records from the target table (meaning, marking a record as 'Deleted' instead of physically deleting them).
MAPPING.NAME: SIL_APTermsDimension

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This expression transformation helps in customizing this mapping. If you are adding new columns to this mapping and you have special logic/treatment for your own columns, this expression transformation box acts as a placeholder for all your transformations. For example, if you are adding three new columns, you should pull them all the way from the Source Qualifier to the Filter directly (unless you need this for comparing as well, in which case you have to take it through the update flag transformation box as well). From the Filter, your columns go inside this custom transformation box where you can play around with these. After you're done, take the output ports straight to the Update strategy transformation, and from there, to the target.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Exp_Custom

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This filter transformation prevents processing of records that have a UPDATE_FLG value of 'X'.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Fil_W_AP_TERMS_D

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This Update Strategy transformation is the place where actions are taken based on the value of the Update Flag, whether to Insert or Update the record into the datawarehouse. If the Update Flag is (I or B or S), records are inserted. If it is (U or D), records are updated. For all other values, records are rejected.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Upd_W_AP_TERMS_D_Ins_Upd

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Update Strategy Expression
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: IIF(UPDATE_FLG = 'I' OR UPDATE_FLG = 'B' OR UPDATE_FLG = 'S', DD_INSERT, IIF(UPDATE_FLG = 'D' OR UPDATE_FLG = 'U', DD_UPDATE, DD_REJECT))

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION:
This expression transformation evaluates the value of the "Update Flag", a port which is used to take actions (like Insert/Update) downstream in the mapping. The possible values that an Update Flag may take are (I = Insert new record), (B = Insert new record and mark for soft delete), (U = Update existing record), (D = Update existing record and mark for soft delete), (S = Type2 enabled) and (X = Reject). For more information on the evaluation logic, please see the description of the port "UPDATE_FLG".
For existing records, a given set of columns are compared to decide whether or not to update the record. If you wish to add more columns to this list, you can extend the comparison (which happens in a variable port called "SYSTEMS_COLS_DIFF").
The mapping parameter $$TYPE2_FLG controls the slowly changing feature of this dimension. Possible values of this flag are 'Y' or 'N'.
If $$TYPE2_FLG = 'Y' (Slowly changing feature enabled), then for existing records, a given set of columns that are enabled for Type-2 (history) tracking purposes are compared to decide whether or not to insert a new record. If you wish to add more columns to this list, you can extend the comparison (which happens in a variable port called "TYPE2_COLS_DIFF").
If $$TYPE2_FLG = 'N' (Slowly changing feature disabled), no special comparison happens for the out-of-box provided history tracking columns.
However, for either of these to work, you should also extend the previous lookup transformation to output your requested columns from the target table.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Update_Flg

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(DECODE(CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, CHANGED_ON_DT) != DECODE(LKP_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, LKP_CHANGED_ON_DT), 'Y', IIF(DECODE(AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT) != DECODE(LKP_AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, LKP_AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT), 'Y', IIF(DECODE(AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT) != DECODE(LKP_AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, LKP_AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT), 'Y', IIF(DECODE(AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT,NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT) != DECODE(LKP_AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, LKP_AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT), 'Y', IIF(DECODE(AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT) != DECODE(LKP_AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT, NULL, SESSSTARTTIME, LKP_AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT), 'Y','N' )))))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: SYSTEMS_COLS_DIFF

TRANSFORMFIELD.DESCRIPTION:
The update flag is evaluated using logic, the English description of which is as follows:
Basic Checks: If the current ETL Process Identifier is same as target record's ETL Process Identifier, then it is already loaded and hence no processing required (result X for Reject) - STOP.
Checks for new records (where target's ETL Process Identifier is NULL) : If stage delete flag = Y, then insert record and mark it for soft-delete (result B for insert with soft-delete) - STOP. If stage delete flag <> Y, insert into target (result I for Insert) - STOP.
Checks for existing records (where target's ETL Process Identifier is NOT NULL) : If stage delete flag = Y and target delete flag = Y then no processing (result X for Reject) - STOP. If stage delete flag = Y and target delete flag <> Y then update target and mark for soft-delete (result D for Updates with soft-delete) - STOP.
Checks for existing records w.r.t source effective dates : If target source effective from date > stage source effective from date then no processing (result X for Reject) - STOP.
Checks for existing records with Type2 flag = Y If stage delete flag <> Y with difference in Type2 columns then enable Type2 (result S for Type2 enable) - STOP. If stage delete flag <> Y with no difference in Type2 columns but difference exists among non-type2 comparison columns, then update record (result U for Update) - STOP. If stage delete flag <> Y with no difference in Type2 as well as non-type2 columns, then no processing (result X for Reject) - STOP.
Checks for existing records with Type2 flag <> Y : If stage delete flag <> Y with difference existing among non-type2 comparison columns, then update record (result U for Update) - STOP. If stage delete flag <> Y with no difference existing among non-type2 comparison columns, then no processing (result X for Reject) - STOP.
TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: IIF(ETL_PROC_WID = LKP_ETL_PROC_WID, 'X', IIF(ISNULL(LKP_ETL_PROC_WID), IIF(DELETE_FLG = 'Y', 'B', 'I'), IIF(DELETE_FLG = 'Y', IIF(LKP_DELETE_FLG = 'Y', 'X', 'D'), IIF(LKP_CURRENT_FLG = 'N', IIF(SYSTEMS_COLS_DIFF = 'Y', 'U', 'X'), IIF(TYPE2_FLG = 'Y', IIF(TYPE2_COLS_DIFF = 'Y', 'S', IIF(SYSTEMS_COLS_DIFF = 'Y', 'U', 'X')), IIF(SYSTEMS_COLS_DIFF = 'Y', 'U', 'X'))))))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: UPDATE_FLG

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: This cached lookup transformation is responsible for getting the required columns from the target table which is compared against the corresponding staging area columns to detect new records or identify changed records. The SQL statement of this lookup transformation is overridden with a join with the staging area table to minimize the amount of records to be cached by this lookup.
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: Lkp_W_AP_TERMS_D

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Lookup Sql Override
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: SELECT TARGET_TABLE.ROW_WID as ROW_WID, TARGET_TABLE.CHANGED_ON_DT as CHANGED_ON_DT, TARGET_TABLE.AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT as AUX1_CHANGED_ON_DT, TARGET_TABLE.AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT as AUX2_CHANGED_ON_DT, TARGET_TABLE.AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT as AUX3_CHANGED_ON_DT, TARGET_TABLE.AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT as AUX4_CHANGED_ON_DT, TARGET_TABLE.ACTIVE_FLG as ACTIVE_FLG, TARGET_TABLE.ETL_PROC_WID as ETL_PROC_WID, TARGET_TABLE.W_INSERT_DT as W_INSERT_DT, TARGET_TABLE.EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT as EFFECTIVE_FROM_DT, TARGET_TABLE.EFFECTIVE_TO_DT as EFFECTIVE_TO_DT, TARGET_TABLE.DELETE_FLG as DELETE_FLG, TARGET_TABLE.CURRENT_FLG as CURRENT_FLG, TARGET_TABLE.DATASOURCE_NUM_ID as DATASOURCE_NUM_ID, TARGET_TABLE.INTEGRATION_ID as INTEGRATION_ID, TARGET_TABLE.SRC_EFF_FROM_DT as SRC_EFF_FROM_DT FROM W_AP_TERMS_DS STAGE_TABLE, W_AP_TERMS_D TARGET_TABLE WHERE( CASE WHEN TARGET_TABLE.SRC_EFF_FROM_DT = $$LOW_DATE THEN 'Y' ELSE TARGET_TABLE.CURRENT_FLG END) = TARGET_TABLE.CURRENT_FLG AND STAGE_TABLE.DATASOURCE_NUM_ID = TARGET_TABLE.DATASOURCE_NUM_ID AND STAGE_TABLE.INTEGRATION_ID = TARGET_TABLE.INTEGRATION_ID AND STAGE_TABLE.SRC_EFF_FROM_DT = TARGET_TABLE.SRC_EFF_FROM_DT ORDER BY TARGET_TABLE.DATASOURCE_NUM_ID, TARGET_TABLE.INTEGRATION_ID, TARGET_TABLE.SRC_EFF_FROM_DT --

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Lookup condition
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: DATASOURCE_NUM_ID = IN_DATASOURCE_NUM_ID AND INTEGRATION_ID = IN_INTEGRATION_ID AND SRC_EFF_FROM_DT = IN_SRC_EFF_FROM_DT

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This expression transformation helps in customizing this mapping. If you are adding new columns to this mapping and you have special logic/treatment for your own columns, this expression transformation box acts as a placeholder for all your transformations. For example, if you are adding three new columns, you should pull them all the way from the Source Qualifier to the Filter directly (unless you need this for comparing as well, in which case you have to take it through the update flag transformation box as well). From the Filter, your columns go inside this custom transformation box where you can play around with these. After you're done, take the output ports straight to the Update strategy transformation, and from there, to the target.
INSTANCE.NAME: Exp_Custom

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This filter transformation prevents processing of records that have a UPDATE_FLG value of 'X'.
INSTANCE.NAME: Fil_W_AP_TERMS_D

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This Update Strategy transformation is the place where actions are taken based on the value of the Update Flag, whether to Insert or Update the record into the datawarehouse. If the Update Flag is (I or B or S), records are inserted. If it is (U or D), records are updated. For all other values, records are rejected.
INSTANCE.NAME: Upd_W_AP_TERMS_D_Ins_Upd

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION:
This expression transformation evaluates the value of the "Update Flag", a port which is used to take actions (like Insert/Update) downstream in the mapping. The possible values that an Update Flag may take are (I = Insert new record), (B = Insert new record and mark for soft delete), (U = Update existing record), (D = Update existing record and mark for soft delete), (S = Type2 enabled) and (X = Reject). For more information on the evaluation logic, please see the description of the port "UPDATE_FLG".
For existing records, a given set of columns are compared to decide whether or not to update the record. If you wish to add more columns to this list, you can extend the comparison (which happens in a variable port called "SYSTEMS_COLS_DIFF").
The mapping parameter $$TYPE2_FLG controls the slowly changing feature of this dimension. Possible values of this flag are 'Y' or 'N'.
If $$TYPE2_FLG = 'Y' (Slowly changing feature enabled), then for existing records, a given set of columns that are enabled for Type-2 (history) tracking purposes are compared to decide whether or not to insert a new record. If you wish to add more columns to this list, you can extend the comparison (which happens in a variable port called "TYPE2_COLS_DIFF").
If $$TYPE2_FLG = 'N' (Slowly changing feature disabled), no special comparison happens for the out-of-box provided history tracking columns.
However, for either of these to work, you should also extend the previous lookup transformation to output your requested columns from the target table.
INSTANCE.NAME: Exp_W_AP_TERMS_D_Update_Flg

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: This cached lookup transformation is responsible for getting the required columns from the target table which is compared against the corresponding staging area columns to detect new records or identify changed records. The SQL statement of this lookup transformation is overridden with a join with the staging area table to minimize the amount of records to be cached by this lookup.
INSTANCE.NAME: Lkp_W_AP_TERMS_D

METADATAEXTENSION.DESCRIPTION: The target data model version that this mapping is designed to load
METADATAEXTENSION.NAME: OLAP_Version

WORKFLOWVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Error message for this task's execution
WORKFLOWVARIABLE.NAME: $SIL_APTermsDimension.ErrorMsg
